definition: surname Li/abbr. for 禮記|礼记[Li3 ji4], Classic of Rites
system/to control/to regulate/variant of 製|制[zhi4]

sentences.english: Will tell from the appearance, its take the praise highly that expressional China traditional culture makes to the ceremony seriously.
sentences.chinese: 从外形来讲，其重视表现中国传统文化对礼制的推崇。

sentences.english: In the later stage of Shang dynasty and later, the structure was convergent.
sentences.chinese: 商晚期后，形制趋同，体现了礼制的规范与完善。

sentences.english: History is set up in the court-related agencies to manage the system of officiating.
sentences.chinese: 历代更是在朝廷中设立相关的机构对礼制进行管理。

sentences.english: The period of Erlitou Culture is the time of the Chinese courtesy formation.
sentences.chinese: 二里头文化时期也是中国礼制体系形成时期。

definition: Rites and Ceremonies, part of the Confucian Classic of Rites 禮記|礼记[Li3 ji4]

pair of annual sacrificial ceremonies held by the emperor in ancient times: one in the southern suburbs of the capital (bringing offerings to Heaven) and another in the northern suburbs (with offerings to Earth)
(Confucianism) rites and music (the means of regulating society)

three principles and five virtues (idiom)/the three rules (ruler guides subject, father guides son and husband guides wife) and five constant virtues of Confucianism (benevolence 仁, righteousness 義|义, propriety 禮|礼, wisdom 智 and fidelity 信)
former kings/former emperors/in Confucian writing, refers esp. to the sage rulers Yao 堯|尧[Yao2], Shun 舜[Shun4], Yu 禹[Yu3], Tang 湯|汤[Tang1] and the kings of Zhou
to regulate/rules and regulations/regulatory/style and structure (esp. of building)
